page.title: 04FARMING AROUND DELABOLE
page.content: Farms are usually between 100 and 300 acres. Stock-rearing (sheep, beef and dairying) is predominant, most crops providing animal fodder: grass for grazing, silage and hay; barley for animal feed and bedding. Dairy cattle are commonly Friesians, sometimes Jerseys. Most milk goes to the cheese factory, but some farmers sell milk direct to the public or make cream and yoghurt, feeding the skim milk to the pigs. Dairy cattle,lambing ewes and young beef cattle are normally in-wintered and fed silage, hay, barley straw and crushed barley. In spring the muck is spread on the fields; some artificial fertilisers are also used. Few labourers are used as most jobs are mechanised and profit margins are small. Wives are often active partners on the farm.
